vish-vass-b01b2465.postDetails:
In less than 60 seconds, Steve Jobs offers a powerful lesson on leadership...

Back in the spring of 1992, Steve Jobs was invited to speak to a group of students at the MIT Sloan School of Management.

At one point, a student asks Jobs this poignant question:

"What’s the most important thing that you personally learned at Apple that you’re doing at NeXT?"

Wisdom follows...

"I'm not sure I learned this when I was at Apple, but I learned it based on the data when I was at Apple," he began. 

Jobs continued...

"I now take a longer-term view on people. In other words, when I see something not being done right, my first reaction isn’t to go fix it. It’s to say, we’re building a team here. And we’re going to do great stuff for the next decade, not just the next year, and so what do I need to do to help so the person that’s screwing up learns–versus 'how do I fix the problem.'"

Leadership starts with articulating a future motivating state that your team believes in. 

You have to make it so that  they see themselves in this vision, that they play a role in making it come to life. 

The lessons Steve Jobs shares with us is to believe in the potential of people and work with them to grow into that person. 

Coach. Collaborate. Enlighten. Mentor. Encourage. Support

Don't step in to fix things. This disheartens people and tears down their confidence, hope, and ambition.

Understand...
Build people up.
Let them try.
Share lessons, but let them give their best.
When mistakes are made, let them learn and grow.

This is EQ in motion. You also teach people to take the longer-term view with others...


#leadership #innovation #leader #motivationalspeaker #motivational  #inspirational

Dear #Nonprofits...

I know this is the busiest time of the giving year. But for the love of Pete, *please* do not seglump, or blanket your appeals. If I've been a donor to you for years and you send me a letter with the phrase "if you are a donor to us..." that's an insult and it's downright lazy. 

It doesn't take a fancy database to run a simple "donor/non-donor" merge.  Even Excel can sort this way. If you can find the staff person to print the letters, then you can do this simple segmentation.  Because if you don't know whether I'm a donor to you, you won't miss me.

#Fundraising should never be assumed. It is earned and built on trust and relationships.  So, in the rush to get those Giving Tuesday promotions, e-appeals, and print appeals out the door, stop and look to see if you are speaking to your audience in a way that shows you know who they are. There are many reasons why #donor retention is below 50% and this is definitely one of them.

#powerupyourfundraising
#marketing

AR applications can make a great impact on learning by making this activity fun for children . We are currently working on a prototype app where kids can see their favorite characters come to life while reading a new book . The idea is to have the animated characters narrate certain sequences of the book to the readers , another idea is to enact a virtual scene that corresponds with the book at certain places .

While this is a work under progress , we are looking for publishers who are interested in collaborating to create some cool AR based learning tools together . 

Jaideep Sundriyal Shailendra Jha

It’s the International Day of Yoga. Don’t sit back, don’t relax. 
Get up, Get moving! 

Follow some of the simple habits to be healthier at the workplace:-

1.Take a five-minute walk every two hours 
2.Stand up and stretch at least once an hour
3.Spend thirty minutes standing at your desk
4.Keep yourself hydrated
5.Sit up straight. That should be your posture!

Happy International Day of Yoga 2019.

Important Notice: 
 
If someone in a close relative/friend circle has died due to Covid-19 or for any reason, ask the bank for an account statement or passbook entry from 01-04-YY to 31-03-YY of the financial year.
 
Check the transaction of Rs. 330/-* and highlight it.
 
Go to the bank and you may claim for the Insurance of Rs. 2,00,000
 
In the Year 2015, the Government of INDIA provided Two Insurance Schemes to the Savings Account Holders of All the Banks: 
 
Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) at Rs 330 and Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY) at Rs 12**.
 
2 Lakh Rupees
 
Many of Us might have Filled this Form. The premium will also be debited from their Account on 31/05.
 
Spread this Message to All Bank Account Holders
 
Rs. 2,00,000/- is Not a Small Amount for People. And especially for the family who lost their Member.
 
- MOST IMPORTANTLY:-
 
The claim is to be done in just 30 days of death only.
Otherwise not eligible.
Edited: 
*Possibility of deduction of proportionate premium by Bank for the financial year is also possible under PMJJBY.
**The scheme of PMSBY, that is a Personal Accident product may not cover Covid against which premium of Rs. 12 was paid.

I interviewed a candidate through Skype last week.

During the call, I heard kids crying in the background. His wife was also talking. The experience was too noisy.

The room he sat was clumsy. I was a bit disappointed.
I expected a more professional approach from him.

Somehow, he felt my disappointment while answering my questions and became unsettled. He stuttered several times.

After the interview, I told him I wasn't impressed with how he presented himself.
He burst into tears, "I am sorry, Sir. I live in a room with my family. There's nowhere they could have stayed.

"We used to live in a bigger apartment before I lost my job three years ago. This is all I can afford for now. I have failed my family. I know I have." He said in tears.

I felt bad. I had no idea that he was going through a tough time.
I apologized and encouraged him not to feel heartbroken. After all, he's trying his best.

Besides, he did well in the interview.
I gave him the contract and asked if he'd like to start next month.

He couldn't believe it because he thought I was going to dismiss him.

He shouted out for joy, "Hey baby, I got the job."
I saw his wife came to hug him.
I was moved.

I learned never to judge anyone. Life isn't balanced. Let's try to make someone smile.

#behuman

I see a #paradox brewing for a while now & many dabbling in it, cause of its #complexity.

#Marketing, is getting more & more #specialist, 
so is an unsaid #demand for a generalist at #leadership levels to drive brand #singularity. 

--

WHY, you ask...

We see #heterogeneous functions driven by deep #skills - 
#AdTech
#PerformanceMarketing
#SEO
#SocialMarketing
#ContentMarketing
#BrandMarketing
#PR
#CRM
#Alliance
#ProductMarketing & similar.

Yes, the #KPIs are different but they all feed into the singularity of intent - #BusinessGrowth. 

--

What we are seeing is app/online based companies changing the AGE OLD GAURD of #MarketingTeam & #SalesTeam.

One creating a #PULL with solid brand narratives.
Other doing a #PUSH with distribution, pricing, offers.

--

Here is how I see it, 
A simple cut to a complex Tyrannosaurus Rex.

In the NEW WORLD ORDER:

SALES DEPARTMENT is the PERFORMANCE MARKETING DEPARTMENT. 

ONE responsible for turnover in the near term, short term ROI.

OTHER responsible for driving oneness in narrative, important when business scales.

This narrative justices premium & drives differentiation among competition, long term ROI.

--

Different KPIs - #OneGoal

The era of the #GENERALIST is at the horizon & one who discounts the other is being myopic.
